meanings.sent1: The volcano is eruptible, meaning it can explode at any moment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist warned about the eruptible nature of the volcano.
meanings.sent3: The eruptible volcano seemed to be in a playful mood today.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like an eruptible volcano, ready to blow at any provocation.
meanings.sent5: The eruptible volcano loomed ominously over the village, a constant threat.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a sign that a storm was eruptible in the near future.
meanings.sent2: The tension in the room was palpable, making the situation feel eruptible.
meanings.sent3: The eruptible situation at the party was diffused by a well-timed joke.
meanings.sent4: Their argument was like an eruptible volcano, building up pressure with each word.
meanings.sent5: The eruptible conflict between the two countries kept the world on edge.
